III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section Sufficiency of staff.
Description (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth has gone AWOL two times from the facility and presented
at the Emergency Room. The youth feels unsafe due to other
youth bullying him. The youth went AWOL two times in one day
and went to the hospital both times There are concerns with
supervision.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was contacted by phone on 8/25/2025. Complainant
did not provide any additional information regarding this allegation.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility 8/27/2025.
Youth A reported going AWOL from the facility because other
youth bully him. Youth A reported the other youth bully him by
calling him names. Youth A reported the youth who bully him
mostly are Youth C and Youth D. Youth A reported Youth C and
Youth D have also hit him before and left scratch marks on his
face. No marks were visible at the time of the interview. Youth A
could not recall the last time marks were left. Youth A reported
staff try to prevent bullying and him getting hit by keeping them
separated, telling them to stop, and getting physically in between
them. Youth A identified Youth B as a witness to him being bullied.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility 8/27/2025.
Youth B reported Youth A starts fights with others on purpose.
Youth B reported Youth A will say things to others to upset them
such as things about their family. Youth B reported staff intervene
by asking him to stop and staying around him. Youth B reported it
is hard for staff to keep Youth B separated from everyone he
argues with because he will pick on everyone.
Youth C and Youth D were interviewed separately face-to-face at
the facility 9/10/2025. Each reported Youth A calls people names
and tries to pick fights with anyone around. Each reported getting
into altercations with Youth A and that they have gotten physical
with slapping or kicking. Each reported staff intervene every time
and stay close to Youth A. Each denied a time in which staff failed
to intervene.
2

Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2, Supervisor 3, Staff 1, and Staff 2
were each interviewed separately face-to-face at the facility on
9/10/2025. Each reported Youth A consistently gets into
altercations with other youth by calling them names and
attempting to fight them. Each reported due to his behaviors,
Youth A is kept under close supervision with a staff and
or/supervisor nearby at all times. Each reported intervening by
getting in between Youth A and other youth and utilizing verbal
redirection. Each reported Youth A has said he does not want to
be at the facility. Each reported Youth A stated he did not feel safe
due to other youth not liking him yet Youth A instigated all the
altercations they observed him in and heard him say often he was
trying to get taken to the hospital in order to leave the facility.
Documentation Review:
• Incident Report dated 8/23/2025 states Youth A went
AWOL at 7:29 PM.
• Behavior Support Policy classifies AWOL as a critical
incident that is to be reported to the Division of Child
Welfare Licensing as soon as possible within 24 hours.
Analysis A rule violation is not established regarding this allegation. It was
consistently reported in interviews staff provided adequate
intervention and supervision. There is nto sufficient evidence to
support Youth A AWOL’d due to inadequate supervision.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150
Section Incident reporting
Description (3) If an institution determines that a youth is absent without legal
permission, then the institution shall immediately report the
information to law enforcement, the parent/legal guardian or next
of kin, the licensing authority, and the referring agency.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility did not report Youth A's AWOL from 8/23/2025 to the
Division of Child Welfare Licensing.
Investigation Interviews:
Consultant, who is the assigned consultant with the Division of
Child Welfare licensing (DCWL), was contacted by phone on
8/25/2025. Consultant reported not being informed of Youth A’s
AWOL from 8/23/2025.
3

Documentation Review:
• Incident Report dated 8/23/2025 states Youth A went
AWOL at 7:29 PM.
• Behavior Support Policy classifies AWOL as a critical
incident that is to be reported to the Division of Child
Welfare Licensing as soon as possible within 24 hours.
• Email authored by Program Manager states there is no
documentation to show DCWL was notified of the
8/23/2025 AWOL within 24 hours.
Analysis A rule violation is established regarding this allegation. It was
reported and documented that the 8/23/2025 AWOL was not
reported to DCWL within 24 hours.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A acceptable corrective action plan is required.
